book_name: CAE Oxford Human Performance and Limitations

questions.question: What is the most effective way of analysing personality?
How would a person who is aggressive and changeable be described?
What are the personality traits of a good pilot?
What characteristics will authoritarian pilots display?
options: a. Are autocratic on most occasions
b. Are autocratic with the crew of the aircraft but submissive when dealing with an emergency or when under stress
c. Are autocratic when in command and submissive when confronted by someone of higher perceived status
d. Tend to be authoritarian when dressed in uniform and when dealing with both air and cabin crew

questions.question: What "P" and "G" qualities should a pilot have?
How will a person tend to react if they are confronted with a decision from someone they perceive as having a higher status?
options: a. Listen to, believe, and comply with the decision

questions.question: If an average ability group make a decision, is it likely to be better or worse than one made by the individual members?
If a group - with someone who has above average ability - makes a decision, is the decision likely to be better or worse than one made by the above average person on their own?
options: c. It depends on the number of the members of the group

questions.question: Is a group decision likely to be more or less risky than one made by the individual members?
What should a Captain do before making a non-urgent decision?
options: a. Put his own view forward and then ask for the opinions of other members of the crew
c. Encourage ideas from the crew before stating his own opinion

questions.question: Language is:
options: d. verbal communication which is open to cultural problems

questions.question: Self-discipline is an essential quality of the "ideal" pilot.
Is a constituted crew an advantage in commercial aviation?
What are the three types of Cockpit Authority Gradient (see p243)?:
There is no place at all for authoritarianism in the air.
The Laissez-faire cockpit may arise when:
options: a. the Captain is suffering from stress
c. on a competent co-pilot's leg
d. on an incompetent co-pilot's leg

questions.question: To counteract an authoritarian cockpit crews should:
options: a. ensure that they ensure that their opinions are heard in spite of possible confrontation
b. remain silent and sort it all out on the ground
c. cooperate in a conciliatory form but the contents of this cooperation is firm
d. obtain support from another crew member
